longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and/or passport replacing documents must be valid
  on arrival. 

Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Holders of normal passports issued
to nationals of Romania can obtain a visa on arrival for a
max. stay of 45 days. Fees vary. (SEE NOTE 52375) (SEE NOTE
52379)
    NOTE 52375: Provided holding:
   - 2 passport photos (3.5cm x 4.5cm);
   - passport copy.
    NOTE 52379: Those traveling for business must hold a
   letter of invitation from hosting organisation.
Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Romania will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to  P. vivax
  exists from June to October inclusive, particularly in
  southern areas (Khatlon Region), and in some central
  (Dushanbe), western (Gorno-Badakhstan), and northern
  (Leninabad Region) areas. Recommended prevention in risk
  areas: C.
